runs.comm: short, tucked off the hips to short square leg
length ball, smashed on the up over cover. He's gone for it first ball and although he doesn't quite middle it, the shot goes a reasonable distance before its reeled in
pitched up and this time he tees off over midwicket, swinging powerfully through the ball. Little footwork but with a eye like that, none was needed
length, beaten outside off stump. And Finn gives Zia and early earful
length and again Zia has a welt, the bat turning in his hands as the ball flies to deep backward square leg
on the stumps and hitting the top of the pad
length, pulls hard but misses the ball
tossed up, slower ball outside off and Zia misses with an expansive drive. The delivery was out the back of the hand - a Dernbach special - and foxed the left-hander
length, swung hard out to deep backward square, fielded by Bairstow in the deep
length, outside off and defended back to the bowler
beatifully timed off his legs, slightly overpitched by Dernbach and the batsman pings a glance over midwicket for four
loose, slingy ball, well wide and clubbed over the infield for another boundary out to deep extra-cover. The dancing girls (yes, even in Dubai there are T20 cheerleaders) go wild

my word, he's thrown the sink, the oven and the microwave at that! It wasn't all that short but Zia picked it up immediately, swinging it away over fine leg ... If that was a top edge, it was some top edge!
length, on the stumps and hoicked high over midwicket, chased down near the boundary rope
Finn's being hit off his line, swinging one down the leg side
again Zia flings the bat at a length ball on his legs, doesn't quite connect properly this time but the ball drops just over Pietersen's head as he ran back from midwicket
swivel pulls, misses with the bat but deflects very fine off the pads
ah, done him - Finn's slower ball deceives Zia, who is too quickly through his drive and only succeeds in looping it to mid-off. And Finn doesn't half give the batsman a send off too!
pitched up and clipped in more orthodox - but no less brutal - fashion through midwicket
outside off, length ball and guided to third man
length, outside off and Shafiq chops into the ground while attempting to run the ball fine
bit of width, cut hard straight to point where Morgan, thnaks to his cat-like reflexes, is already poised to throw at the stumps
played short towards point but again fielded swiftly by Morgan
fuller length, punched to mid-on
length, defended square on the off side and the batsmen quickly abort an attempted dash for one
short, too much width, uppercut over the infield. Lovely stroke from Shafiq, who looks unflappable
straighter, chopped into the off side

hit high, high, HIGH but not far enough ... and dropped! It was another slower ball, scooped just over mid-off and Graeme Swann got there with plenty of time to spare before botching a simple catch over his shoulder
back of a length, on the stumps, whipped hard through midwicket to the sweeper in the deep
outside off, deflected to third man
fuller ball, worked to short square leg
length, on the stumps, knocked short on the leg side
good line and length, Hafeez drives expansively but into his pads via an inside edge
maintains that probing line, pushed off the back foot to cover
back of a length, on off, defended on to the wicket
spots Shafiq backing away and follows him, forcing another defensive stroke
on the stumps, flicked fine where long leg comes round to prevent a boundary
beaten outside off and there's an attempted stumping - but his back foot didn't leave the crease
dabbed fine to give short third man a chase
flighted, chipped down the ground to long-on
telegraphed as Shafiq reversed his hands early, but he executed it well, sweeping fine from outside off - and some clumsy relay fielding down at third man gifts Pakistan another run
room outside off and chopped through point
striaghter, worked from in front of his pad to square leg
cutter, pitched up outside off and chopped into the ground
outside off, taking the pace off again, flicked to square leg
impudent stuff from Hafeez! He stepped out and scooped the ball from a length outside off, over the infield and down to long leg. Has Hafeez finally found his touch again?
pulled hard from in front of his body to deep midwicket
full, worked to midwicket from in front of the stumps
width, whipped cut shot through cover-point

on off, turning to hit the pad ... and they turn down a run, with Shafiq scrambling to make his ground. The umpires call for a review. This could be close ... Kieswetter fielded the ball at short square leg and fired a throw to Swann, who took the ball in front of the stumps and then had to swing his arm round behind him to break the wicket. And because his elbow disturbed the bails - with the ball in his hand - he managed to beat Shafiq's dive!
tossed up outside off, played back to the bowler

flighted, slog-swept but not enough on it ... this time Bairstow makes no mistake with the catch, coming round from deep midwicket. Apologies, I think I might have jinxed Hafeez a few balls back. But, in my defence, that was a stupid time to play such a shot, with Shafiq just out
on off, defended into the off side
flighted, gives it the charge and hacked to mid-on
full, outside off, turned to midwicket but quickly snaffled by the fielder and that ends a fine over from Swann. England are right back in this
length, outside off, pushed square
pitched up, swinging away a touch, and a thick edge goes well wide of the diving Kieswetter
golf shot from Afridi, another thick edge that flies down to third man this time
length, jabbed short behind point
full, touch of movement again, square driven past the diving man at point
full again, driven on the front foot but well stopped by Bopara at extra-cover

and he's got the danger man! Afridi chips a full ball from leg stump to midwicket. A very simple chance to Eoin Morgan who didn't have to move to take it with two hands at head height. Afridi tried to use his feet, Swann fired it into leg stump and it just popped up to the fielder
full on middle stump and defended forward
well bowled, done all ends up by an old-fashioned arm-ball outside off stump

another for Swann! This has been some impact. Akmal with a very poor shot, not catching a big heave down the ground and Dernbach races in from long off to tumble forward and take a fine catch down low, he nearly fumbled it. Akmal didn't learn from the previous game
length outside off, forward to defend
forward on off stump to push back to the bowler
paddle swept, very fine down to the fine leg rope
Misbah steps outside the leg stump but only drives to mid on
now covers up on leg stump
goes to paddle sweep again but this time misses, runs off the pad to square leg
turned off a length to the right of midwicket
full on off stump and pushed back to the bowler
swept hard but on the floor straight to the deep fielder
tossed up outside off, Malik down the track and pushing to long on
turned away from a length out to the deep fielder off the back foot
turn onto leg stump and flicked to the 45
length and blocked on off stump
aerial but away from midwicket into the deep
middle stump and driven in-to-out to long off
off stump again and driven out to long off once more
length and driven to extra cover
back of a length, punched off the back foot to long on
step back and pulled away but only as far as deep midwicket
shot! Massive hit over long on. They had to do something and here it is, a couple steps down and a heave off middle stump into the terraces. A fine clean strike
length into the thigh pad, runs out on the off side and they scamper through for a run
full and driven through the covers
poor from Finn, leg side off the pad and runs fine for four
walk across his stumps and clip through square leg, a good scramble off the boundary saves the second
full length outside off stump and late cut to third man
a dance both ways across the stumps but in the end taken from off stump to long leg with a flick
Misbah steps away and cut out to deep cover
flicked in the air for a time back to the bowler from off stump
down the wicket, dragged down, Malik adjusts and blocks into the off side

down the ground......six! Just over Swann at long off. It went high, high into the sky but just enough club to get it over the fielder. It was a swing from a full length on off stump with Misbah clearing the front leg
back foot punch to long on
another back foot punch down the ground, this time to long off
short and flicked very fine for four, well played off the hip
full outside off, a swing and a miss with no footwork
length outside off, driven off an edge very fine again, this time to third man and a brilliant diving save from Dernbach saves two runs
fired in to the pads, runs into the leg side and good running brings two
full outside off, dug down to long off
fine nut, swings away a touch and Misbah pokes at it and misses
full and dug out to point
slower ball deceives Misbah who drives on middle and leg and gets an edge to short long leg
another well-executed slower ball and Malik doesn't pick it, trying to cut far too soon and missing outside off stump
it's another slower ball, this time on middle and turned to midwicket from a length
but this is a little wrong, a full toss outside off, slapped to deep cover
another full toss but this time just dabbed to point
great shot, that is beautifully played with the wrists, guiding it past point for four to third man, delicately played
big slap down the ground to long on from a full ball outside off
short and wide and just angled into the off side, in the air through cover
back of a length outside off, another late cut attempted and it's through to the keeper
fuller but this time Malik connects with the late cut and guides it very nicely between point and third man
length and pushed through midwicket, they race back for a second, more good runnings
back of the hand slower ball and beats the Misbah heave outside off
cut away and missed by Swann at short third man, that's a dreadful miss, away for four
driven to extra cover and they run through
brilliant again, ducks in full just outside off and it beats the batsman again
but now the full quick yorker, comes off something and bounces over the keeper for four! Must have been a bottom edge but it ballooned over Kiewswetter

smashed into the off side off a bit of an edge and Bairstow takes a blinder, screaming off the long off boundary and diving to take the catch coming forward. That is fine work going to his left with two hands
